H/T @WoodsHoleResCtr, Dr. Sue Natali @ArcticPermafrst, Dr. Jennifer Watts and their many co-authors whose scientific work has alerted us to this major new driver of climate emissions. Only though science can we truly understand the scale & urgency of the growing #ClimateCrisis. pic.twitter.com/fzksE3wHm2

Hard to overstate the impact here. At the low end, this means Arctic permafrost melt could be adding the equivalent of the entire emissions of New York State to the atmosphere, every year until 2100. Hundreds of millions of cars worth of carbon. We must #ActOnClimate now. pic.twitter.com/rjUrqekgro

These new Winter Arctic emissions are a new discovery being tracked by these researchers. That means these are emissions that have not been factored into IPCC and other global climate projections so far. pic.twitter.com/rsc2zMUPZk

This powerful research shows us that warming permafrost is now causing increased microbial activity in the WINTER, a new development that is dramatically increasing emissions. This could mean the release of up to 27 BILLION TONS of carbon into the atmosphere by 2100. pic.twitter.com/M3C1jryMpH

Releasing that carbon will significantly increase the total greenhouse gas in Earth's atmosphere, which will further warm the Earth, thaw more permafrost, release more carbon, and on and on. pic.twitter.com/IhQkr4twCk

Right now, there is 2x as much readily-available carbon in cold and frozen arctic soils (a.k.a. permafrost) as there is in the entire Earth‚Äôs atmosphere. And the Arctic is warming at more than twice the speed of the rest of the planet. pic.twitter.com/iNGAgdnqNq

Devastating findings from these leading #climate researchers on Arctic permafrost emissions yesterday. Thanks @ClimateCrisis Chair @USRepKCastor for joining me to talk through these troubling results from @ArcticPermafrst & many other scientists sounding the alarm. #ActonClimate pic.twitter.com/fPYbVRxN8j

Each of the 20 were special. Let their names and stories fill our voices today, and let their memories be forever part of who we are and guide us for another year. 

May they Rest In Peace.
To stand with families and friends who have lost immeasurably, to grieve with them, to struggle with them, to try again to pick up the shattered pieces of ourselves in a shared, soulful remembrance.

The first anniversary of any tragedy brings a painful renewal of grief and loss. In these times, even if we think there is nothing more we can say, we come together to remember, to hug, to tell stories and shed tears. And so today our communities gather together once more.

Their faces and voices that night of the first vigil have stayed with me. Thousands had converged to remember the lost, to stand with their friends and loved ones in painful solidarity, to grieve together.

Today marks one year since the fateful October afternoon when 20 souls, beloved by their families, friends & communities, were lost in a terrible limousine crash in Schoharie, New York. 

For a year their loved ones have carried the weight of an unfathomable anguish.
pic.twitter.com/NI2p816Sgd

The #Schoharie limo crash was the deadliest of its kind, but it was not the first. And if we fail to act, it will not be the last. We owe these families a tremendous debt of action. I will not stop until the reforms that they inspired & have helped us advance are signed into law. pic.twitter.com/VIsWupZDTV

For a year we have carried these wounds, none heavier than those of the families who lost their loved ones. The night of our vigil, with thousands of us standing by their side, they called for a response, for strong standards that close dangerous loopholes & put safety first. pic.twitter.com/cq2offOhYF

One year ago our communities gathered to mourn an unspeakably tragic loss of life: 20 souls were taken in a preventable collision in #Schoharie, NY by a limousine that should never have been allowed on the road. I stood with the families today to announce our national response. pic.twitter.com/yNptPkRYp2

Standing with family members of victims of the tragic #Schoharie limo crash and with my fellow NY Congressional leaders @SenSchumer & @RepDelgado in my home and hometown of Amsterdam, NY to announce our national limo safety plan.
